Saroo Brierley made it back to Ganesh Talai on February 12 2012. He d been lost for over 25 years. All those years earlier on the same night he stepped up into that empty carriage his brother Guddu died hit by a train not far from the platform. Saroo s mother Kamla had never given up hope of Saroo s return and had never moved away. Kamla said she was surprised with t hunder that her boy had come back and that the happiness in her heart was as deep as the oc ean '.. Saroo learned that all those years ago as a five year old he had been mispronouncing his own name.. He was Sheru ', meaning LION "..

So I've seen this movie a couple months back and decided to rewatch this and MY GOD what was I not seeing the first time. After watch ing this movie I felt like I lived through 20 years of life I felt like I was the main character Saroo The discoveries you make as a child the innocent feeling of not really knowing things but also being excited with what s to come Experiencing beauty kindness and the generosity of people ..... and a lso seeing the dark side of them And then when you grow up you start to look back at your childhood as a beautiful time filled with joy and wonder All of these things I've felt watch ing Lion The mystery of time and the sadness of when you realize it s passed by. There were multiple conflicts that Saroo had to go through in each stage of his life which I thought was handled very well He had to survive the streets when he was a kid. Then he had to get used to his new life in Australia. Family drama then becomes a huge issue once his adopted brother enters his life When Saroo finally searches for his home back in India there is a huge effect on his relationship with t he people around him which was only natural to happen but could have easily been glossed over by the I have to find my way home story. So really high praise to the film makers for putting the emphasis on the human relationships first. Sunny Pawar and Dev Patel come together to bring the c haracter of Saroo to life Saroo does feel like a different person from when he was wandering around in India compared to his later life in Australia But as his intentions get clearer and feels the need to search for home you also feel like rooting for him because Dev Patel is just so charming and likable. Nicole Kidman as Saroo s adoptive mother conveyed a lot of conflict within what seems like a nice happy person on the surface. Once Saroo s troublesome brother enters her life she struggles to keep the family together I really liked that the movie never failed to acknowledge the family dynamic that was slowly being detrimental. The film explores life and it felt like a whole package of one m a n's journey From exploring his homeland moving to a different country exploring life and relationships there and eventually finding your roots and searching the way back ho me. Make sure you bring your tissues before the end ing because it ll get to you.

This is a really well acted well plotted well present ed story about a small child in India who falls asleep on a train and gets lost only to be adopted by an Australian couple from an ophanage When he s in his twenties he follows the suggestion of someone at a party to use Google Earth to try to locate the town he was from and reunite with his biological family There are inner conflicts and issues with his adoptive family to be dealt with b ut he eventually starts to put the pieces together to fill in the gaps left by his childhood separation The conclusion is a very powerful example of a story reaching a climax and tying up all the strands of the narrative almost perfectly This is a great movie about what it means to be alive.

Just have watched the movie LION and have remembered that I saw Dev Patel who played the main character in this movie at TIFF last September.
